SEARCH
Package emissary.directory

Class KeyManipulator

java.lang.Object
emissary.directory.KeyManipulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class KeyManipulator extends Object implements Serializable
A class of utility methods for manipulating dictionary keys. Keys are stored in the dictionary with the following format: dataType.serviceName.serviceType.location$expense Example: UNKNOWN.servicename.ID.tcp://host.dom.com:8001/FilePlace$5050
For the example key above the return values are as follows:
routine return value
dataType UNKOWN
serviceName servicename
serviceType ID
serviceHost host.dom.com:8001
serviceHostURL http://host.dom.com:8001/
serviceLocation http://host.dom.com:8001/FilePlace
expense 5050
serviceClassname FilePlace
dataID UNKOWN::ID
defaultDirectoryKey *.*.*.http://host.dom.com:8001/DirectoryPlace
See Also:

    • addRemoteCostIfMoved

      public static String addRemoteCostIfMoved(String from, String to)
      Add in the remote overhead to the "to" key if it was a move
      Parameters:
      from - the key we came from
      to - the key we went to
      Returns:
      the "to" key with remote overhead or as it was

    • makeProxyKey

      public static String makeProxyKey(String origKey, String proxyKey, int dfltExp)
      Mangle origKey such that the host on proxyKey becomes a proxy for it
      Parameters:
      origKey - the original key
      proxyKey - the key representing the place that wants to proxy
      dfltExp - default expense to use if origKey has none or -1 for no dflt
      Returns:
      a key with the original data type, service type and service name and expense but the new place location from proxyKey

    • getDefaultDirectoryKey

      public static String getDefaultDirectoryKey(String key)
      Build a key to the directory of the place represented by the key
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the place to find a directory for
